item.title: Kelly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "I started my life with a single absolute: that the world was mine to shape in the image of my highest values and never to be given up to a lesser standard, no matter how long or hard the struggle." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Kelly add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Let us again pretend that life is a solid substance, shaped like a globe, which we turn about in our fingers. Let us pretend that we can make out a plain and logical story, so that when one matter is despatched—love for instance—we go on, in an orderly manner, to the next. " -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Love is the longing for the half of ourselves we have lost." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Amanda Cross
item.description: "A literary academic can no more pass a bookstore than an alcoholic can pass a bar." -- Amanda Cross

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Writer's block is a fancy term made up by whiners so they can have an excuse to drink alcohol." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Kelly add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "History, Stephen said, is a nightmare from which I am trying to awake." -- James Joyce

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kelly add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "I lie to myself all the time. But I never believe me." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If you look for perfection, you'll never be content." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for." -- Bob Marley
